text: Every day I see my house,
which is 20 minutes from this hotel, and I can’t go.
From February 15, passengers arriving in the United Kingdom from a list of risk countries
must isolate themselves in a hotel for ten days, paying 1,750 pounds.
We spoke to some passengers who stayed at one of the hotels designated by the Government.
Once arriving at customs, they asked us where we came from.
If we came from South America or from the countries on the “red list”.
those of us who came from South America, they put us aside
And then they escorted us to a bus.
Here you can see our room, the window, you can't open the window.
I have a routine, I created a quarantine routine.
Here I do yoga or Pilates to release some adrenaline.
Guests receive three meals a day
They ring the bell and they leave the bags.
The food that we liked, was small.
The portions, I have photos and they are like this.
When we arrived they gave us this document, which indicates
that you can order food at other places, such as Uber Eat.
They didn't say anything about cleaning supplies, they didn't say anything.
We didn't know if we could go out or not.
There we called reception and asked: “Can we walk a bit? How does it work?
We are watching people here through the window ”.
That's when they said, “Yes, you can go out for 15 minutes.
You have to call and we will take you outside ”.
I was happy to know that we were not completely imprisoned.
For us it is essential to have more than 15 minutes in the parking lot
because I suffer from anxiety and panic attacks.
Several passengers expressed doubts about hygiene and social distancing protocols.
When they deliver meals, some days they wear gloves, other days they don't.
And it is “here you have it, we received it in hand and well.
The quarantine scheme includes two tests.
In relation to the tests, you wake up that day and think: "today I have to do the test".
When we got to the hotel we had to do one test on day 2 and on day 8.
They brought us the first test, they brought us separate black bags.
And they give us instructions on how to register them on the NHS page.
Now we just did the second test, so I am like this, looking at the phone every minute to wait for the result.
People who test positive have to stay 10 more days and pay £ 152 per day for each adult.
I think the government measures they have taken are excessive.
1700 pounds is a lot, I have spoken with other people who have not been working either
and who do not have the possibility of having a family member to help them, like in our case.
I think the measurement is correct, but I think the cost is very high.
There are people who do not earn that per month.
"We are taking decisive action at the borders and every essential check will help prevent the importing of new coronavirus variants into the UK."
"Every step is taken to reduce risks and to minimise any potential for passenger interaction." Department of Health and Social Care, UK
"All staff at our properties have been trained in the Radisson Hotels Safety Protocol which includes mandatory use of PPE along with sanitation and hygiene procedures" Radisson Hotel
